channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How Harris will distinguish her foreign policy from Biden — and Trump
item.description: By necessity, Vice President Harris has worked in lockstep with President Biden on his foreign policy. What she would do in the White House if she wins on Nov. 5 will be in focus in Tuesday's debate.
item.content:encoded:
By necessity, Vice President Harris has worked in lockstep with President Biden on his foreign policy. What she would do in the White House if she wins on Nov. 5 will be in focus in Tuesday's debate.

(Image credit: Tobias Schwarz)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Ukraine's military trains civilians in 'Test Week' to give a sense of war with Russia
item.description: Ukraine needs more soldiers as its troops defend Ukrainian territory and carry out an offensive inside Russia. An elite Ukrainian military unit offers civilians a one-week tryout as soldiers.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine needs more soldiers as its troops defend Ukrainian territory and carry out an offensive inside Russia. An elite Ukrainian military unit offers civilians a one-week tryout as soldiers.

(Image credit: Oksana Parafeniuk for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Polina Lytvynova

item.title: Killed in her pink roller skates, a Palestinian girl’s photo in Gaza goes viral
item.description: The photo of a girl in Gaza killed by an Israeli airstrike while wearing pink roller skates goes viral and draws attention to the plight of children nearly a year into the war.
item.content:encoded:
The photo of a girl in Gaza killed by an Israeli airstrike while wearing pink roller skates goes viral and draws attention to the plight of children nearly a year into the war.

(Image credit: Mahmoud ssa)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Debates have proved a tough test for vice presidents running for president
item.description: A look back at other sitting vice presidents who were running for the top job and debating on TV against the nominee of the opposition party: Gore in 2000, George H.W. Bush in 1988 and Nixon in 1960.
item.content:encoded:
A look back at other sitting vice presidents who were running for the top job and debating on TV against the nominee of the opposition party: Gore in 2000, George H.W. Bush in 1988 and Nixon in 1960.

(Image credit: Grace Widyatmadja/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Taylor Fritz wins match to become first American man in a U.S. Open final since 2006
item.description: Taylor Fritz surged with a six-game run against a fading Frances Tiafoe, also of the U.S., to come out on top 4-6, 7-5, 4-6, 6-4, 6-1 and reach his first Grand Slam final.
item.content:encoded:
Taylor Fritz surged with a six-game run against a fading Frances Tiafoe, also of the U.S., to come out on top 4-6, 7-5, 4-6, 6-4, 6-1 and reach his first Grand Slam final.

(Image credit: Seth Wenig)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With no crew aboard, spacecraft Starliner lands without a hitch
item.description: The spacecraft landed in New Mexico early Saturday morning leaving two astronauts behind on the International Space Station. The crew members will return to earth in February aboard a SpaceX craft.
item.content:encoded:
The spacecraft landed in New Mexico early Saturday morning leaving two astronauts behind on the International Space Station. The crew members will return to earth in February aboard a SpaceX craft.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Cockpit audio indicates issues with de-icing in deadly Brazil plane crash
item.description: The pilots of a Brazilian passenger plane that crashed last month, killing all 62 people aboard, reported failure in the system to remove ice from the plane, according to a preliminary report.
item.content:encoded:
The pilots of a Brazilian passenger plane that crashed last month, killing all 62 people aboard, reported failure in the system to remove ice from the plane, according to a preliminary report.

(Image credit: Andre Penner)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Man charged with plotting shooting at a Jewish center on anniversary of Hamas attack
item.description: A Pakistani man was arrested in Canada this week for plotting a mass shooting at a Jewish center in Brooklyn on the one-year anniversary of the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, federal authorities announced.
item.content:encoded:
A Pakistani man was arrested in Canada this week for plotting a mass shooting at a Jewish center in Brooklyn on the one-year anniversary of the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, federal authorities announced.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Rich Homie Quan, a hitmaker who helped rap evolve, dies at 34
item.description: The Atlanta hip-hop star Rich Homie Quan rose to fame nationally in 2013 with his first hit single “Type of Way” and had a short but intense burst of success. He died Thursday.
item.content:encoded:
The Atlanta hip-hop star Rich Homie Quan rose to fame nationally in 2013 with his first hit single “Type of Way” and had a short but intense burst of success. He died Thursday.

(Image credit: Alberto E. Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Rodney Carmichael

item.title: U.K. is investigating Ticketmaster after Oasis tour prices surprised fans
item.description: British regulators are looking into how Ticketmaster uses "dynamic pricing" to hike prices in line with demand. A similar controversy prompted a federal lawsuit against the company in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
British regulators are looking into how Ticketmaster uses "dynamic pricing" to hike prices in line with demand. A similar controversy prompted a federal lawsuit against the company in the U.S.

(Image credit: Matt Cardy)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman
